thread.title: Police: Woman charged with fraudulent credit card use - Glencoe News
thread.title_full: Police: Woman charged with fraudulent credit card use - Glencoe News

author: Pioneer Press
title: Police: Woman charged with fraudulent credit card use - Glencoe News
text:
The following items were taken from Glencoe Public Safety Department reports and press releases. An arrest does not constitute a finding of guilt.
WARRANT ARREST
Karianne Rado, 27, of the 1100 block of Green Bay Road, Glencoe, was arrested on an outstanding warrant of possession of drug paraphernalia from the Cook County Sheriff's Office at 10:10 a.m. Sept. 16 after she was stopped at the intersection of Dundee Road and the Edens Expressway, police said. She was released on a $5,000 bond and has a scheduled court date of Oct. 7 in Skokie.
DRVING WITHOUT A LICENSE
Jose Tellez-Cuevas, 48, of the 600 block of Sheridan Road, Highwood, was charged with driving without a license and speeding at 7:56 a.m. Sept. 12 after being stopped near the intersection of Green Bay Road and Scott Avenue, police said. He was released on a $1,500 bond and has a scheduled court date of October 2 in Skokie.
REVOKED LICENSE
Mohammad Aqib, 20, of the 6200 block of Mozart Street, Chicago, was charged with driving on a revoked license, driving without insurance and possession of drug paraphernalia at 12:50 a.m. Sept. 13 after being stopped near the intersection of Forestway Drive and Tower Road in Winnetka, police said. He was released on a $2,000 bond and has a scheduled court date of Oct. 2 in Skokie.
Suburban Chicago arrest photos Open link SUSPENDED LICENSE
Desmond L. Trapp, 20, of the 17900 block of Old Trail Road, Hazel Crest, was charged with driving with a suspended license, disobeying a traffic control device and obstructing justice at 3:56 a.m. Sept. 13 after he was stopped near the intersection of Dundee Road and the Edens Expressway and provided a false name and date of birth, police said. He was released on a $1,500 bond and has a scheduled court date of Oct. 2 in Skokie.
DUI
Art Pogre, 54, of the 600 block of Ivy Lane, Glencoe, was charged with driving under the influence of alcohol, improper lane usage, destruction of city property, hit and run and illegal transportation of alcohol at 7:28 a.m. Sept. 13 after a complaint was received from a store employee on the 100 block of Green Bay Road and Pogre was arrested on the 600 block of Ivy Lane, police said. He was released on a $3,000 bond and has a scheduled court date of Oct. 2 in Skokie.
Andrew Pettigrew, 69, of the 1500 block of Walbridge Avenue, Toledo, Ohio, was charged with driving under the influence of alcohol, driving with a blood alcohol content higher than .08 and improper lane usage at 8:56 p.m. Sept. 14 after he was stopped near the intersection of Green Bay Road and Temple Court, police said. He was released on a $3,000 bond and has a scheduled court date of Oct. 2.
IDENTITY THEFT
Andrea R. Dillon, 43, of the 200 block of 117th St., No. 1, Chicago, was charged with illegally using credit cards on Sept. 1 in a case that was originally reported to Glencoe police on May 8; she was arrested by Wheeling police, police said. She was being held in Wheeling upon multijurisdictional charges and had a preliminary court date of Sept. 11 with no further information available.
